title: Jack Wells (rugby league)
text:
Jack Wells (born 21 September 1997) is a professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a forward for the <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford Red Devils</a> in the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a>.
He played for the <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan Warriors</a> in the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a>, and spent time on loan from <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> at both the <a href="Swinton%20Lions">Swinton Lions</a> and the <a href="Toronto%20Wolfpack">Toronto Wolfpack</a> in the <a href="2019%20RFL%20Championship">Betfred Championship</a>.
Background.
Wells was born in <a href="Salford">Salford</a>, <a href="Greater%20Manchester%2C%20England">Greater Manchester, England</a>.
Playing career.
Wigan Warriors.
He has spent time on loan from <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> at both the <a href="Swinton%20Lions">Swinton Lions</a> and <a href="Toronto%20Wolfpack">Toronto Wolfpack</a> in the <a href="2019%20RFL%20Championship">Betfred Championship</a>.
Salford Red Devils.
On 16 December 2020 it was announced that Wells would be joining the <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford Red Devils</a> for the 2021 season; his hometown club and the club he supported as a boy.
